channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council staff leaving bags of waste for foxes to raid, 8th June
item.description:
Each time a blue bag of waste is left on or near this bin overnight, foxes rip the bag open and spread the contents over the street. Can I ask the council workers to stop doing this please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Kelmore Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping, 8th June
item.description:
Dear [Council Name] Environmental Services, I am writing to report ongoing fly-tipping in the alleyway located at between 56-58 slades drive, BR76JX Over recent weeks, people have been leaving rubbish and various household waste in this area, effectively turning it into a dumping ground. The situation is getting worse and is causing: • A health and safety concern for residents, especially children and pets • An increase in pests, foul odours, and unsightly conditions • A sense of neglect that may encourage further dumping I kindly request that the council take action by: • Arranging for the immediate removal of the dumped rubbish • Investigating the matter and, if possible, identifying those responsible • Installing warning signage or considering CCTV enforcement to deter future fly-tipping • Monitoring the area more regularly I have attached photos (if available) and can provide further details if needed. This matter is affecting the wellbeing of residents, and your urgent attention would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time and support. Yours sincerely, Ms Stephens 07850400201

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Slades Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black removable speed hump broken, 8th June

item.title: Abandoned vehicle outside 51 Moordown, 8th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked here for over a month with no one returning to collect. It’s not a car that’s been here before and having checked with neighbours on the local WhatsApp group it’s not anyone local. Vehicle appears to have a fake registration number/untaxed. The location is just outside 51 Moordown SE18 3LY

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moordown, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous fly tipping from flats above shops, 8th June
item.description:
Will continue to report this on a weekly basis (as this is how often it happens). Other persons report regarding this shows name of person dumping rubbish. This needs to be followed up and fly tipping team need to fine those doing it. Issue is - rubbish is dumped @ weekend. By the time Monday comes and fly tipping team can attend to investigate, bin men have already collected rubbish. Current fly tipping - foxes have ripped open rubbish and now whole road is scattered with offensive food and materials. Needs CCTV, or fine the person doing it (who can be clearly identified from other persons report that was submitted today)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
